newsitem.title: USA: Sprint PCS starts service in 8 more cities.
newsitem.headline: Sprint PCS starts service in 8 more cities.

text.p: Sprint PCS said Wednesday it has launched its Personal Communication Services (PCS) wireless phone service in eight more cities, bringing the total number of cities covered to 30.
Sprint PCS recently started offering service in Austin, Philadelphia, Denver, Boulder, Rochester, Wichita, Louisville and Kansas City.
"We continue to launch Sprint PCS service across the country on a very aggressive schedule," Andrew Sukawaty, chief executive of Sprint PCS, said in a statement.
Sprint PCS said it is on target to launch service in 65 cities by mid-year.
Sprint PCS is a partnership of Sprint Corp, Tele-Communications Inc, Cox Communications Inc and Comcast Corp.
